thread.title: MWest Holdings Announces Three New Hires

author: cnbc.com
title: MWest Holdings Announces Three New Hires
text:
LOS ANGELES, March 9, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- MWest Holdings, a Los Angeles-based real estate and investment firm with over 2 million square feet of residential and commercial property across the U.S., today announced three new hires, including Frank Woodworth as Senior Director of Business Development and Operations at Hutton Brickyards, Jamie Pawlowicz as Director of Capital Projects, and Kathleen Wolf as Marketing Director.
"Frank, Jamie and Kathleen all offer tremendous talent and expertise that will support the continued growth of MWest Holdings and our affiliated organizations," said Karl Slovin, President, MWest Holdings. "I'm delighted to welcome them to the MWest family as we continue to grow our portfolio of historic Los Angeles properties and revitalize the historic Hutton Brickyards into an experiential venue to host world-class events and programming."
As Senior Director of Business Development and Operations, Mr. Woodworth is responsible for programming, event curation, and daily operations at the Hutton Brickyards. A recognized expert on innovation in the music industry, he previously worked at Strange Loop Music, Eleven Music, and Universal Records.
As Director of Capital Projects, Mr. Pawlowicz manages the design and construction of the MWest Holdings portfolio. With a variety of experience across project management, architecture and construction, Mr. Pawlowicz managed over 71 capital projects before joining the firm.
As Marketing Director, Ms. Wolf oversees all marketing, public relations, and promotional activities in support of MWest Holdings, Polaris Property Management, and Hutton Brickyards. She has twenty years of experience in the real estate industry, previously managing marketing for a national portfolio of nearly 20,000 units.
Over the past eight years, MWest has acquired and invested in rehabilitating eleven historic buildings across Los Angeles including the San Fernando Building, Wilshire Royale, Hollywood Tower, and Park Wilshire. MWest also recently commissioned world-renowned French artist Thierry Noir for massive public mural at The Lofts at NoHo in commemoration of the 50th anniversary of Berlin and Los Angeles as sister cities. In addition, MWest is currently revitalizing the Hutton Brickyards in Kingston, NY into a world-class destination for the arts and culture.
About MWest Holdings . MWest Holdings is a vertically integrated real estate investment and property management company with over 2 million square feet of residential and commercial property across the United States. Founded in 1991, MWest is known for creating innovative development solutions that instill a sense of neighborhood and integrity and create a lasting, tangible value. The company specializes in enhancing classic, core-plus and value-add properties, as well identifying opportunistic strategies that showcase fine or historic architecture and invigorate the culture and aesthetics of communities they serve. As a highly successful and stable owner and operator of real estate, MWest has continually employed sound business practices, low leverage and stringent underwriting guidelines for each investment opportunity. The company's success is anchored in a philosophy that imagination is the only limiting factor to growth. For more information, please visit: http://mwestholdings.com/
CONTACT: marketing@mwestholdings.com
